website_summaries.verdict: A versatile hydration waistpack with an innovative water bottle holder position that allows for more space in the storage pocket.
pros: Holds a standard 12-ounce water bottle cozily within its single mesh holder
Allows bottle to be removed and replaced easily during a jog
Inside valuables pocket is a nice plus for travelers
cons: Strap is on the short side
Bottle holder bands may snap after a few uses
Bottle may bounce and slosh during runs

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Im training for my first half marathon and o noticed my arm going numb from the arm cell phone carrier so i decided to switch things up to the fanny pack and let me tell you I AM SO HAPPY with this product!!! 2 separate zipper compartments. My galaxy phone fits in with PLENTY of room. The water bottle compartment holds a 16oz bottle of water just fine while having plenty of room for a larger sized bottle
customer_reviews.author: yenttrib

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased ... for the first 4 times I used it. Last week I used it the fifth time and the bottle band broke dumping my 12 oz. water bottle in the dirt. It's now useless. Shopping again. UPDATE: Upon hearing this, Kay, at My Carbon, reached out immediately and sent me another running belt. She reports that the elastic water bottle loop has been reinforced. I'm glad to hear this because I like everything about the product. Thanks for rectifying my problem without me asking!
customer_reviews.author: Duke PT

customer_reviews.title: The best thing about this pack
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't hold a lot but it does hold the essentials. I have another pouch I slide onto the belt if I need extra space. The best thing about this pack, and the main reason I bought it, was because I like the way it holds your water bottle sideways. It has an elastic strap that goes over the top of your bottle to make sure it doesn't fall out. It's easy to get your bottle in and out, and comfortable to carry. If you're not carrying a bottle, the bottle holder folds away in a zip compartment so you have a normal looking pack that's not bulky. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Really like it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good versatile waist pack. Note if you do not get it tight enough around your waste it will juggle around when your water bottle is full. That said, I don't think you can do any better out there without the water bottle being specifically built for the waste band. I like being able to use whatever water bottle I want. The storage compartment for my phone and doggy bags is perfect. My only comment for a future generation of the pack would be to improve the belt holders. They don't really hold very well but this is very minor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great small fanny pack
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small fanny pack, I love that a water bottle has its own space, not a whole lot of space inside though, enough for $$ and id cards and phone, not really for anything thick. We used for a school trip to an amusement park.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Young

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for runs where you need just one water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I've been running long distances for many years, and this pack is perfect for runs where one water bottle is enough. It holds my 6" cell phone, 2 energy bars, a standard-sized water bottle, car keys, and a light pair of gloves, comfortably. The water bottle stays put while running and does not come out, but it's easy to remove and replace while running. It fits snugly right above my hips and doesn't move around. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Petrizzo

customer_reviews.title: Didn't quite work for me
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of this bag and was so excited to try it out however when I put the water bottle in the front as designed it tilted too much forward and kept causing the belt to loosen up. Maybe it was the weight of the particular bottle I was using or the items I had inside but it was just awkward for me when I was walking. Perhaps it will work better on a larger person too. I am 5'4" and 115 lbs. and it was large on me.
customer_reviews.author: hugbunches

customer_reviews.title: Although this product is a nice fanny pack
customer_reviews.text: Although this product is a nice fanny pack, it is NOT a runners fanny pack. I read all of the views before making the decision to purchase this. It does not stay in place because the strap is not elastic. There is absolutely no way a "real" runner can use this. I was looking for a fanny pack for my marathon training here in Florida. Carrying water is a must, but not with this product. I didn't even make it 1/2 a mile when I had to get rid of the water bottle that bounced around and 1 mile in a had to take off the pack, which is clunky! Very disappointing and a waste of time to purchase...
customer_reviews.author: Maritssa

customer_reviews.title: Good for jogging
customer_reviews.text: I got it for trail jogging with friends and to carry my phone without vibration. Very compact, and works with bottled water to help hydrate. Due to standard size, you could swap bottles on laps. I also prefer taking a swig from a bottle to sucking on a tube, personally, so this works well for me. A much cheaper alternative than camelbaks if you want something basic, and aren't concerned about looking a bit silly with a fanny pack. ;)
customer_reviews.author: P. Antal

customer_reviews.title: Good Utility but LACKS DURABILITY
customer_reviews.text: I bought one to train and participate for a half-marathon. It worked well for me in terms of utility, however, after only 7 months of use, the zipper that holds the phone in place broke, rendering the product useless. I only used it a few times a week and I'm fairly careful using my gear, so I have to attribute the zipper breaking to poor build quality. Too bad, because I liked the overall design/utility however I will NOT be buying another one, I'll look for a competing product.
customer_reviews.author: Alamosakid

customer_reviews.title: Great for holding water bottle.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little pack and the best part is that it holds a water bottle. It said there is a pocket in the back to hold a phone. There was even photo of that pocket online. Unfortunately, the pack did NOT have that pocket, which makes it less useful. It is comfortable to wear, but the waistband keeps loosening so I keep having to retighten it as I go. I still really like it, but I would have preferred it to have the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great design and quality
customer_reviews.text: The waist pack is very well made, and is just the right size for what I need. It’s obvious that a lot of thought was put into the design— all the little extra features are handy, and include some I wouldn't have thought of. Love the water bottle holder. Love the loops for hanging additional stuff. You can cram a lot of stuff into the pockets, without the pack bulging too much. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anita G Doran

customer_reviews.title: Not for runners
customer_reviews.text: This is a well constructed pack but the water bottle feature is not well designed. Most running packs have some way to pull the bottle tight to your body but this one is more of an after thought that flops around horribly while running. It's a nice idea and good for walking or other activities but it's not a good solution for running. Since it was advertised as a running pack, I'm marking it down quite a bit for that. If you're not running with water then you might like this solution?
customer_reviews.author: wishbone

customer_reviews.title: Pretty small & Practically useless
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use as my dog walking bag, and am so disappointed. Within the first week, the key hook broke, not to mention, why isn't the key hook IN the bag? Why is it outside the zipper? And WHY ISN'T IT STRETCHY?! My tin water bottle doesn't fit so it just slips and slides out constantly. And with a water bottle in, good luck fitting anything else in there! I can barely fit my essentials (wallet, keys & phone) in there. Wish I could still return it bu I'll be throwing in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Caputo

customer_reviews.title: easy water access and great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I love this little fanny pack. I went to Thailand for a month. I had a pack pack and it is always so hard to just reach for the water bottle. With this pack the water is right there. I wore it on the front of my body. It had just enough room for a lipstick and blush. There is a compartment in the back for your dollars. I I saw a few reviews where people have said that certain parts of it fell apart. I think the company has fixed that because I used it every day for a month and it stayed intact. I also use it for walking and short hikes. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: leslie

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: I have wide and long bottles and they all fit. Great for runners and works well when riding my unicycle. It also fits my wallet and my samsung Galaxy S7. The bottles won't fall out and is balanced on the lower back when worn. This one is better than the other ones because you can bring your own size bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Liann

customer_reviews.title: Not for runners. Great for walkers!
customer_reviews.text: So if you are just walking this is a great product. Set it to your size and clip it on. Great for carrying water and i can even fit my note 9 (quite a large phone) in the bag part. IF YOU PLAN TO JOG/RUN do not get this item. It does not stay still. It bonces and slides up and is all around awful for running no matter how well it holds your stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Hbugg96

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for walking not running
customer_reviews.text: I just started running this year. I bought this hoping I could take a small water bottle with me because it has been hot af this summer. I tried wearing it on the front and back, but it was too annoying for me. The pack constantly smacks the booty or rubs in the wrong way, I had to take the water bottle out and carry it. Otherwise it seems to be well made and it fits a lot of things in it. It would be good for a long walk, not so much for running in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh... I’d rather be thirsty that wear this thing.
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews, I thought there would be potential for this fanny pack to solve my hydration woes while running. I hate holding onto things while I run, but also despise when things bounce around. I currently have another fanny that fits snuggly but doesn’t hold a water bottle. I was excited for this one, only to ditch it less than a mile into a 6-mile run! Even after taking the bottle out, it continually rode up, and bounced around. I’d skip this fanny pack if your doing anything more than walking!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Bottle shakes while running
customer_reviews.text: The bottle shakes a lot when I run. I tried more than once and tried all kind of tricks to keep it from shaking. Nothing works. So after three runs (two of them are longer than 18 miles), I realized that this is not a product for me. If you are going to carry water for RUNNING, then I do not think this works. The constant shaking of the bottle, in the vertical direction while running, make the back muscles very sore (if the bottle is placed in front) or the ab muscles very tight (if the bottle is placed at the back). So I had to return this after 2 weeks of trial.
customer_reviews.author: Yale Indi

customer_reviews.title: Best Fanny Pack around
customer_reviews.text: Best Fanny Pack out! This thing holds my Phone,my license,debit card, my prescription,a 12 ounce water bottle that can not fall out it has a pocket to hold the bottle,with a loop strap over the cap to keep it secure. We order just 1 to see,if it was what we were looking for,since there are so many out there. We since have ordered 2 more (1 as an extra spare). Well built,no issues with zipper,tearing,we pack it pretty full.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Great price and does the job so far!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this "fanny pack" for a month now and I really, really love it. Yeah, it's not as sleek as the other ones on the market - not quite as stylish, but then I pack a lot of "stuff". I carry my IPhone 6Plus (my phone case is a wallet) a large set of car keys, Kleenex, a protein bar and I still have plenty of room. I also carry Vitamin Water from Costco in the bottle. The bottle holder works great! This pack is well made. Not too sure about the plastic clip that is used to put around your waist, but so far I haven't had any problems. Definitely worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: BF

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for runners
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pack for running. The size is perfect. It’s not large like a fanny pack. It’s slimmer. It holds an iPhone 8 Plus and a pair of glasses with ease with plenty room for other items. It holds snug to the body and doesn’t flop around when running. The yellow strip you see on the back is actually the zipper. It’s reflective, a nice feature. There are a couple of other smaller reflective bits as well. It is a solid belt, NOT elastic, so it cinches up as tight as you want it. It doesn’t budge. I really like this pack. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Fusor

customer_reviews.title: Wore this for 5 weeks straight
customer_reviews.text: I wore this while walking the Camino de Santiago, a 500 mile/800 km hike/walk across northern Spain. It was great and allowed me to easily access my water bottle as needed instead of constantly reaching into the side pocket of my backpack. It has a pocket on the inside the rests against your body that was the perfect side for my camino passport and my regular passport.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie C.

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I use a "walking stick" when I take my 2 mile walks. So the stick is in one hand, and my water bottle was in the other. I found that to be very inconvenient, so I was thrilled when I heard about the Waist Pack with Water Bottle. It arrived yesterday, and, needless to say, I was very pleased with it. I liked the idea of the other pockets. I have an IOS6, and it fits perfectly. I am going to be on my way in about an hour, so I will "field test" the Pack, and come back with an update.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: I've tried to make it work
customer_reviews.text: I've tried to love this product and spent a lot of time (months) trying to adjust the straps and get it to fit. I'm a tall guy (6'7", 200 lbs). I attached a small lightweight water bottle and the water bottle is tight once in place but once you start running/jogging at a 8-9 minute pace the waterbottle start will start to jump up and down and it's very annoying to deal with no matter how tight I have the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: Great for a runner!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product both for every day runs and for a 10k I recently ran. It has great pockets (I can put my phone, keys, kleenex, hair ties, and inhaler) as well as room for a water bottle. Now I'm pretty skinny so it tends to bounce around a little in an annoying manner but I've found that is remedied when I wear a jacket or shirt. Super cute and stylish for a fanny pack and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Fanny packs are back!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to get on board with bringing the Fanny Pack back, but this bag made me not care about the fashion. I purchased this to wear at a theme park. It held my car keys, phone, ID, cash and credit cards snugly on my hip. The water bottle holder is a nice feature and can handle a standard-sized bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: It’s only okay
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but it’s incredibly difficult to adjust the size. And I have to adjust it pretty often because it loosens. So weird.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: A running belt that doesn't make me mad
customer_reviews.text: I have been through several waist packs for running. A lot of them seem to be having trouble keeping up with the size and weight of cell phones. Then my last one made me fight to get the water bottles out. I chose this one because it has a buckle instead of velcro that eventually gives out; seemed the right size for my phone; and has an easily accessible water bottle holder. I've only used it a couple of times so far, but it is much better in all those respects that have been letting me down lately!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Just took this out for a run. I bought this specifically for the water bottle feature. It doesn't work. My 16·9 ounce bottle fell out no matter what I tried. Seeing as thin was the primary reason I purchased the pack I consider this a huge fail. Basically worthless to me as a tool for running. Maybe it requires some kind of special bottle to work properly? Whatever. Cool idea but I wouldn't recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. It holds my propel bottle, phone, keys, etc.! Comfortable and don't have issues with anything falling out. I just wish I could make it a little tighter but still fits nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great all around waist pack for a short outing
customer_reviews.text: This is an adequate waist pack for a few items if you are on a short outing. I bought it for riding my bike and use it to hold my keys, cell phone and some snacks as I am out exercising. It doesn't have room for a lot more than that, but it serves its purpose and looks great. Strap is adjustable to fit a large range of waists up to about 46" so that's a good thing. Adjusting the strap is a little difficult, but you only have to do that once and it does keep it's size so it won't slip once it's adjusted to the correct size. All in all, I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wood

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my otterbox iphone case
customer_reviews.text: i love this bag. it is super light, large enough for my iphone otterbox case about 6.5 inches and i can hold a bottom of water. also love the hidden compartments for cash or card. i use it for running and shopping. perfect for though.
customer_reviews.author: OC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Walking
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for something lightweight to go around my waist when I exercise that will hold my phone and a drink and this is more than I expected. I can put my phone in the pocket to protect it from rain and my earphones have a special hole so that I can listen to music when it is zipped up. and there is enough room for keys and wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very little space - not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Was not what I expected. Fanny pack cannot hold very much. I squeezed my wallet in, but not tall or wide (front to back) enough for my incased cellphone . After squeezing the wallet in, it can't fit anything bigger than a tic tac container. The only thing this is good for carrying is a bottle, but you won't fit anything much more than that. You can clip a cellphone case to it, if your cell case has a clip in it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Boston

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for walking my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this. The size is just perfect. My purpose for the bag is to carry water and a bowl for my dogs when we walk. I am in Texas, and it gets pretty hot. It is large enough to easily hold a 24 oz. plastic water bottle. There is a small clip to which I can attach their bowl, and there is some webbing that can accommodate a carabiner. It is great to have a bag that is balanced when carrying water instead of having one side tugging.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love this fanny pack! I go on long walks and now I can carry around a bottle of water, phone, and keys easily. It seems very durable, I've been using it a couple weeks now. There's not a lot of room but enough to fit essentials.
customer_reviews.author: Bekka Wakenight

customer_reviews.title: Functional and comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and utilitarian- does the job but could use some small improvements. The pocket os, intended for ear buds, is a little too tight to thread the iPhone cable connector through. I’d also like to see a more reflective materials or color choices. I like the multiple pockets and the ability to carry a water bottle in a horizontal attitude vs. vertical. Overall it looks durable and has worked out well for short hikes.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Super functional. It gets a bit heavy if you do add a water bottle to the bottle section, and sometimes it falls out when you bend over or something, but love this walking fanny pack. I am able to store my iPhone 6s plus and keys and cards/money without a problem in addition to the water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made but small.
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived undamaged and well made. It works as described and my only issue is that it is smaller than I expected. It will only hold a few thin items in the pockets and a pretty small water bottle. If you don't want to carry more than a cell phone, a thin wallet and a 20oz. water bottle it will work great for you. For a long hike you would want to bring more than this will hold. Would be great for a short hike or jogging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, lightweight, holds what you need
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Not too big - hold your phone, keys, money. The bottle holder is a sleeve, and it folds into a zip pocket when you’re not using it. This is a great deal for the money!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Love it Love it I can now go on a walk w/ out holding a bottle--P.S. use the loops on either end to hold your bottle in , or it will fall out and scare you. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: not for bigger people
customer_reviews.text: its belt is not big enough butt if someone can sew with machine put heavy elastic on both sides same amount so buckle stays in middle works great and still looks great I and 1 half wide elastic black this can be don for bigger person most waist packs belts are small 38 inch
customer_reviews.author: Edwin O. Penttinen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent exercise pack! Stays put. Not too big.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase! I have been using this fanny pack so my hands are free for weights while walking. The pack is the perfect size to hold my water bottle and my iPhone 7+. I can also fit my headphones, Kleenex, keys and ear sacks (earmuffs) in the interior zipper pocket, yet the overall size isn't very large or cumbersome. The pack is pretty good at staying put with my movement. No regrets so far!
customer_reviews.author: Nadene

customer_reviews.title: lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product before...i loved it...wore mine out so had to buy another...had my last one for four yrs...but i must say it lasted awhile for the price...on another note the new one I purchased was a little different...it didn't come with a zipper on the backside facing my tummy as it had before...but i also use it mostly as a shoulder pack....so if your going to try this product i recommend it...js
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great for a few runs but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this running belt in June and had a week of solid runs using it. It was good. After a surgery, I was just cleared to run again, and today was my second run. Unfortunately, the small strap that holds the water bottle in broke off on one side and my water bottle hit the ground. As I was only halfway through my 4 miler, I had to go the last two miles holding my water bottle. Not fun. It is a roomy and comfortable belt but mine, at least, was not durable at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. May

customer_reviews.title: Great for distance running
customer_reviews.text: A great waist pack for distance running! I need to take water if I run longer than 10k. The trail I like running on doesn’t have water fill stations, so I’ve been looking for a waist pack that can holds enough water. This pack holds an 18 oz CORE beverage bottle very well. I prefer just reusing plastic bottles since they are lighter. I’ve run a bit wearing the pack with the bottle side on the back. No problem at all. So far I can say it’s great to use for running in colder days. Not sure it’ll work fine in the summer when it’s really hot. I’ll see!
customer_reviews.author: Saturn V

customer_reviews.title: Pokemon Go must have
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this when I'm playing pokémon go, it's perfect. Keeps my keys, power banks, cables, water and even phone when I have my go plus. Durable little thing and I like the reflective stripes. I just use a plastic bottled waterwith this, haven't tried a different size but it stretches. Can wear it comfortably in front or on my back, don't notice the weight of the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Dina

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t love water holder part wish it had tighter elastic to keep the water more secure .. however it does have a little loop to help secure which is ok... other than that the pockets are great ! Holds my iPhone 8s my small collapsible water bowl for the doggie and it adjust pretty easy for me or my boyfriend to wear....
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Poppleton

customer_reviews.title: It fits
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit HOLDS everything I need, I have a large smartphone and up till now I could NOT find a fanny that my phone would fit in. I've gone through 3 this last year. SO happy ;)
customer_reviews.author: Wahidah Abdullah

customer_reviews.title: Good size and quality
customer_reviews.text: I didn't end up using it for a water bottle because I didn't like how it sloshes with every step, but it is perfect for holding my phone, keys, and some Kleenex or trail mix on a hike. Also fit my women's size 16 frame. It has held up great, I've had it for about two months.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Nice small pack
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little pack and I think I'll get a lot of use out of it. However, I thought the water bottle holder was much bigger than it is. I think it will only hold a standard water bottle size. So if I go on a longer hike, I probably won't be able to use it because I usually drink a lot of water. The pack would be good for shorter hikes and the compartments are rather small.
customer_reviews.author: Connie E.

customer_reviews.title: Just right for the gym
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small waist pack that would fit my cell phone, a small moleskin notebook and my keys for the gym. This product is exactly what I needed. As an added bonus, should I want to use it to carry my water bottle, I can easily do that. I also like the style and color of this waist pack. This was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Enough room to my iphone with a wallet cover
customer_reviews.text: I found lots of bag to fit my a little big iphone with a wallet cover. It is the right one I like to have. The design of water bottle is also meet my need.
customer_reviews.author: Windy

customer_reviews.title: The bottle holder was cool though, definitely secure for any type of movement
customer_reviews.text: I have a 27" waist and this was just slightly too big. Especially with a full water bottle, it moved too much. Also, I found the pocket sizes too small. It fit a phone and some money or cards, but nothing else. I couldn't fit both a phone and sunglasses as the pictures show. The bottle holder was cool though, definitely secure for any type of movement. I ended up returning it, just didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Good for jogging . Not running.
customer_reviews.text: Good for hicking ot jogging. Not running because it bounces. Then you must find a suitable bottle. Pass
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: This is ok. I never can get the strap tight enough. When running, it bounces in a way that is overly annoying... I expected a fair amount of bounce, but it's too much. I've tried having the pack in the front, back, and both sides, having the pack positioned in the back works best for me. On a positive note: my bottle bottle is snug and I never worry about it falling out. I didn't pay too much for it, otherwise I would have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this for myself and others. It is compact, but fits everything comfortably, including my huge cell and medium-sized water bottle. This is a good bag for short distance runs or walks. When I wore it facing forward, it was a bit jumpy, which was a bit annoying on longer runs (10 miles), but not short runs (3 miles). However, it lays comfortably on my lower back for the long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Livier A. Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item a while back, works great for everything described except it's not waterproof. I was prepping for a River Rafting trip and decided to test the waist pack before using it. I checked the bag for any tears or zipper problems. Everything seemed fine. After pouring water over it for 3 mins, the paper cloth I placed inside was completely soaked. I didn't return it because it's reasonably priced but it does bug me that it didn't live up to its expectation.
customer_reviews.author: David Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The workmanship is very sturdy. So even if you put a bottle of water on the pocket, it'll still hold and won't break apart. I also like that you can adjust the belt. I'm size 14 and there's still a lot of room on it, so i assume it can take up to size 18. Overall, i love this item and I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a waist pack either for hiking, running, walking or something to use when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Hannellene D. Bundalian

customer_reviews.title: Lots of features, large belt size
customer_reviews.text: This is just perfect. I use it to walk my dogs and I attach the leash to the belt. I'm a large person and the belt expands to accommodate my waistline. The bottle stays secure in the pouch with the little loop at the neck. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: S Clear

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient
customer_reviews.text: This makes walking or jogging with my “essentials” SO much easier. Love that it can also hold a bottle of water and I can be hands free! The reflective strip is a huge plus. Seems well made too. Looking forward to getting lots of use out of it!
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Belt for Running
customer_reviews.text: This belt is legit. I've tried so many and returned them all. This belt stays put, fits my iPhone XR with a case, and has lots of room for other things too. The cord for the water keeps everything where it should be and it doesn't bounce. There are also other velcro loops, rings, and areas to hold the essentials for a long and/or night run. It seems whoever designed this belt either is a runner or actually talked to one to see what we needed!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Hudd

customer_reviews.title: She absolutely loves it and says that it was just as good as the reviews said and recommended I get one ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my running friend. She absolutely loves it and says that it was just as good as the reviews said and recommended I get one for myself. I am so happy that it turned out to be a wonderful gift. Nice size pocket for phone and other necessities, water bottle holder ideal, and reflective strip for night running/walking.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: love it, holds a standard size water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Got this pack to use when I go to the gym, love it, holds a standard size water bottle, has just enough compartments for key/remote, phone and change. I hang my membership card on the hanging hook which is perfect. when I work out I take it off an hand it on the treadmill so not sure how comfy it is when running/walking with it on while the water bottle is in the holster. Also like the feature to set the water bottle for either left/right handed person. sturdy material.. great deal!
customer_reviews.author: karren b.

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold water securely
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this because I thought it would hold my water. It definitely does not. The water slipped right out so for that reason it was a waste. Will have to hold my water separately or buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my bike to hold my galexy phone and money, it's great, comfortable to ride with, I take it shopping too just very convenient, very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Conti

customer_reviews.title: Convient!
customer_reviews.text: Good to work out with, but the bottle holder isn't as secure as I hope.
customer_reviews.author: PJB

customer_reviews.title: Water bottle, size
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice waist pack! Fits snug so it’s not moving around, size adjustable of course! Perfect pocket for a water bottle, and has places you can hang things off of also. Can’t wait to wear it on my next hiking adventure!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Overall does the job
customer_reviews.text: Holds my extra water bottle nicely and has room for phone/keys too. I can’t make it as tight as I need (I have a pretty small waist), so it’s always a little loose on me. It bounces up and down when I try to jog, but not sure there’s anyway to avoid that?
customer_reviews.author: orcaspam

customer_reviews.title: Great little pack
customer_reviews.text: Great little pack. Used it to carry my kit during a Spartan Race. It held my cellphone, a credit card, my ID, some cash, car keys, a pair of football gloves, and a water bottle. It is not waterproof (submersible), but during wet obstacles, I would sling it across my shoulder or chest like a bandolier to protect my stuff from water/mud.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke at 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use it that much so I was surprised when the zipper broke today. But I'm going to order another one and hope the zipper lasts longer because it is a good design.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Works for running- just use loop to secure water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Great pockets and hideaway water bottle holder. Water bottle can fall out so I just use the loop around the top to secure it during my runs. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Ford rogers

customer_reviews.title: Cool but why did i get the green one xD
customer_reviews.text: Got it for the Race for the Cure 2018. I love the pockets and I could place my water bottle in any way i want. Will use this again this year when i join the race for the cure this 2019. If they would have some color options, that would be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: DoggoMama

customer_reviews.title: Funny fanny pack
customer_reviews.text: The size of this fanny pack is sufficient. However, my water bottle would not stay put in the holder and was constantly falling to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Norsky

customer_reviews.title: Love this pouch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It is light weight and holds a regular sized water bottle. It is easy to het the water bottle in and out while still walking at a quick pace. I love the hole for the speaker wire so my smartphone is safely in the zipper pouch and I can still listen to my music. It holds everything I need while exercising.
customer_reviews.author: Christine A. Cichan

customer_reviews.title: Super little fanny pack
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to carry my iPhone and keys while I do my daily walks. The pack even has an elastic pouch where a water bottle can be carried. It's easy to adjust, has just the right amount of space to carry small items, and is lightweight. This would be a perfect little pack for amusement parks, short hikes, etc. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Walters

customer_reviews.title: These will not disappoint!!!
customer_reviews.text: It holds a 17 oz thermal bottle perfect, just like the picture shows. It is comfortable, well made, and holds just the right amount of stuff. I am very happy with this and would highly recommend to anyone..
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 4 mile daily walks. I was about to return it because I thought that it would not fit my waist. The seller contacted me and sent me a YouTube video showing me how to extend the belt to fit my waist. That was going above and beyond for the customer! I love that this fanny pack holds my water bottle, phone, and keys.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. D

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat the price for this,
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price for this, best thing is the front pocket pops out to hold a bottle of water, 2 inside pockets to hold "stuff". Snug fit but carries my new Galaxy 8+ very well, Bought one for a freind, now I'm a BEST FRIEND, she loves it arrived on time
customer_reviews.author: David S. Geller

customer_reviews.title: Good waist pack for running or walking
customer_reviews.text: This waist pack serves my needs perfectly. It holds a standard bottle of water, and can hold my phone and car fob easily, as well as room for a few incidentals. When running, it's more comfortable worn in the back, but if just going for a walk, it's fine worn in the front.
customer_reviews.author: Mac-mom

customer_reviews.title: This works great. I can hold water when o need to ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I can hold water when o need to and it is stores horizontally so it's more comfortable when I run. The water bottle pocket folds away to be more sleek when I'm not using it, and the other pockets hold my phone and air horn perfectly. I use this almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie in Cali

customer_reviews.title: Strong zipper, great stitching.
customer_reviews.text: Love this pack. As a longshore"woman"....my pack has endured a lot. It has a lot of grease and dirt on it and the zipper remains strong. it's well stitched and it holds the bottle of water unlike any that I've ever used. When I wear it out I intend to buy another one
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking, not for running
customer_reviews.text: Nice pouch - room for large phones (iPhone plus), and large water bottle. Design for walking is great, but for running not so much, as the weight of the water bottle on the outside causes the entire pouch to bounce throughout the running stride. Too much bounce for a trail runner - thank you Amazon for great return policies!
customer_reviews.author: S. Jan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this comfortable pack. It holds all I need.
customer_reviews.author: Paige5

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Slim!
customer_reviews.text: Love the slimness of this fanny pack! Also love the quality, look and features. Lastly, love that my 8Plus iPhone fits in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Swierc

customer_reviews.title: but i really like it! I'm taking it into the field with ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit smaller than I thought, sacrifice some space for the water bottle holder, which is why I took one star away, but i really like it! I'm taking it into the field with me, and it fits my water bottle, my phone, and my field notebook pretty easily (it sticks out but is pretty secure). It doesn't fit super snug (I'm around 105 pounds, so pretty tiny so I didn't expect it to), but if you weight even a bit more than me you can easily adjust it and it'd fit perfect. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: autumn

customer_reviews.title: Secure, well made belt
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality, well designed product. Very sturdy and comfortable to wear. The reason I rated it 4* instead of 5 is that the space for water bottle is so small, I can't imagine what would fit in that compartment. If you don't need to carry H2O tho, it's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Burmese Boys

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for endurance horseback riding. It accommodates a water bottle, my phone, glasses and a snack for the trail! Great Quality!
customer_reviews.author: P James

customer_reviews.title: light weight, petite sized, practical/secure
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for light day hikes in the Ozarks. Allow for hands free focus. Fits the essentials: iphone 6s, ids, car keys, travel sunscreen, and water bottle. Love the different compartments and strap that allows for hooking on sunglasses. It seems durable. Hoping for many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hiking Pack
customer_reviews.text: This pack is perfect. It holds my 20oz water bottle(it does not move around at all) and power bars. I hang my sun glasses and knife on the looped part of the belt close to the pack. Everything I need for up to a 10 mile hike. Perfect fanny pack for hikers.
customer_reviews.author: karl schwaber

customer_reviews.title: I seriously love this fancy pack
customer_reviews.text: I seriously love this fancy pack... I've never been a fan of them but started working out recently and don't like wearing jackets all the time so this pack is perfect and the water bottle compartment is a plus
customer_reviews.author: Neesy

customer_reviews.title: 3 half marathons and still going
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. There are lots of pockets to store GU, tissue, and pain relievers, my phone fits too. Very happy with the purchase. I have used it many times, including for hiking and running 1/2 marathons.
customer_reviews.author: EliGraceArt

customer_reviews.title: good size
customer_reviews.text: fit my google pixel 2xl and key not much else. wanted it for runs and longer walks. Strong material and zippers run smooth. Slim profile doesn't get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: rp

customer_reviews.title: Great pack. Comfortable to wear during my trail runs
customer_reviews.text: Great pack. Comfortable to wear during my trail runs. I don’t use the water bottle section simply because i don’t like the ‘bounce’. Otherwise, great product
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Smith-Hornberger

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it had a spot for earphones. But I put a regular bottle of water and it fell out as soon as I started moving
customer_reviews.author: Pippy

customer_reviews.title: ... actually wearing a fanny pack can be a bit fun. I think this product would only be better ...
customer_reviews.text: Getting used to actually wearing a fanny pack can be a bit fun. I think this product would only be better if the drink holder could be unzipped creating another pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlock221

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pack on a couple of hikes so far and it was exactly what I was looking for. Big enough for my phone, keys, dog treats and wallet, plus it holds my 15 oz glass water bottle without a problem. The straps stay tight so I didn't have to adjust it at all during the hike.
customer_reviews.author: Snippy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Fanny pack!
customer_reviews.text: I love this fanny pack, perfect for when I walk my dog and fits a 17oz just fine (or two mini waters) fits my phone, wallet, doggie waste bag all just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie D

product_meta.title: MYCARBON Fanny Pack Waist Pack with Water Bottle Holder,Waterproof Running Belt for Men Women,Fits iPhone 8Plus Galaxy S8 Note 8
feature_bullets: 【Unique running fanny pack with water bottle holder 】(THE WATER BOTTLE IS NOT INCLUDED) which can tight the kettle invisibly and conveniently. The water bottle holder is in the front of the running fanny pack water resistant so it won't get in the way of your arms swinging.

【All HAS SMALLER COMPARTMENT】 in the main pocket of the waist bag perfect for credit cards, IDs, single keys, iPhone 7/6S plus Galaxy S5, S6, Note 6, wallet, running accessories etc, this running bag is plenty big for all of your stuff with room to spare.

【ADJUSTABLE RUNNING BELT】 Hydration fanny pack for women and men from sizes 76cm to 115cm(30-45 Inches), you can adjust the waist range of the running belt as your request, and two-way zipper design makes the water pack to be a flexible running pack (Easy adjustable waist pouch).

【MULTIPLE REFLECTIVE STRIPS 】On the cycling water bottle pack MAKES YOUR SAFETY RUNNING at night, and this cycling water bottle hip bag is suitable for hiking, cycling, travel, leisure activities, entertainment(Safety night running waist bag), and perfect as gifts.

【Little HEADPHONE HOLE】 In the bum bag with water bottle holder, you can string your headphones through and enjoy the music when the hydration pack belt is zipped tight and funny wallking with this waist packs.
